page.title: 14Ecology in Blackburn.
page.content: change comes over the landscape.The Droppingwell Conservation Project has now been officially opened by local councillors. This once waste_land has been cleared of debris and rubbish: over 20 tons of refuse,household and industrial were cleared between 1979 and 1984 by local school children. Droppingwell Lane has consequently become one of the prettiest stretches of road in South Yorkshire. Magpies,Jays,Crows and even kestrels have been observed. Several varieties of butterfly can be seen in the summer months fluttering around the hedgerows and trees lining the road. Blackburn school has a superb environmental area with a great variety of wild flowers, shrubs and bushes. Poppies are in flower now and sparkle like rubies amongst the greenery.
